comment: She's not really a bad professor, follow the tutorials = you'll do good. The assignments can be tedious if you have a lot for other classes. Her instructions can be a bit confusing/contradictory and she will have you use AI for a project. ALSO, important: pay very, very close attention to the dates of the reviews on here...you'll see a pattern...

Negative comments are always from the lazy students. Her online instructions are very clear, and she will always respond to your email if you need clarification. I would encourage students to take her course as she gives great feedback. She blends her graphic design background with the real-world projects and that's a plus for the final portfolio

Where to begin! This professor is the type needed in all courses at KSU. She has awards in teaching and national and international competitions. She gives us links to her bio and her website so we can know that she's legit. She is a tough grader and really cares that you learn. The course ends with a great portfolio of curated works. She's firm!

An amazing professor and I would encourage any student to take her class. She is very tough but also very knowledgeable. She should be teaching upper-level graphic design courses as she has her masters in it and she owns her own graphic design business. She is also an author of graphic design books. She gave me one of her books for very good work.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I had to work for my grade. I learned a lot from her in-depth comments and instructor feedback which allowed me to improve on my work. Although I didn't earn an A I was ok with my final grade as all this Adobe programs was new to me. She is an excellent instructor and her projects are solid.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Unlike other professors who teach this same course she does not stick to the textbook. After the tutorials she assigns real-world projects so you can apply the skills you learnt from the tutorials. Other professors give you a A just for doing the tutorials and I know students who copy and do no work. They get easy A, but not so with this professor.

If you think attendance does not matter it does. She marks you present when you complete tasks and submits work. I would take her again because she explains what needs to be done and will take time to clarify things if you only would ask. Her grading sheets gives comments on what to improve to make your work better, and you get back lost points.

This professor really cares for her students. She gives great feedback so you can improve your work and thus your grade. She does not tolerate students who always want more time after they wait too long to do the work and make excuses. She is an excellent instructor and very savvy with the programs. Take her class if you want to learn.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She gives a lot of work but her feedback is really good and will help you improve. She also gives you lost points back if you follow her comments to improve your work. She really wants you to succeed and will help you if you discuss your issues with her.

This professor might be considered difficult but the fact is that she wants you to follow directions in order to acquire skills. Most of my peers want good grades without doing the work, so if you don't want to learn then don't take her. She is among the best!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The projects themselves weren't that difficult. The textbook felt outdated and the workload was a bit much with four other classes. Her instructions are sometimes unclear and contradictory and she, more likely than not, will take points off for any confusion she caused. NOT lenient with due dates at all.

This professor in incredibly difficult to communicate with, she is often condescending to students and will interpret any messages in the worst way possible. Her D2L course is also very disorganized, with vague and contradictory instructions. Do not trust the positive reviews, look how much they contradict the negative ones, and their post dates.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: This might be the worst online professor I have ever taken. She changes her unclear instructions constantly, her D2L page is a mess so it's difficult to navigate and worst of all, she's super rude and condescending! Do NOT take her, she will only make you stress. I wish I dropped out when I had the chance.

Take her! Submit your work to her review before final submission and you will improve your grade. She is tough but fair and will work with you if you're having problems with the work. VERY approachable professor. Any complaints you see about her are students make excuses and want to have extra time. Trust me, she WANTS YOU TO PASS THE COURSE!

If you think you want to take this professor I recommend looking up her instagram and choosing a more qualified professor. She can't layout information in a clear way but rather creates paragraphs upon paragraphs for tutorials that have nothing to do with the project. Course the person with borderline plagarized designs forces student to use Ai!

This professor was very thorough for an online class. She was tough but in a good way. She always provide feedback on our projects before you submit the final project so you could improve it before submitting it. I found her comments on the projects very helpful and allowed me to improve my work. If you need help she will set up a meeting with you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is tough but worth it. I see why some students don't like her and think her class is hard to pass. But meet her deadlines and course expectations. She usually will give you an extended time to complete a project. You must earn her grade so and she gives good pre-reviews for improvement. Pay attention to her comments for improvement.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Mauge-Lewis is not difficult at all. She is very matter of fact and some students don't like that! She tells you what you need to do to improve and divides you into groups to understand that working in teams and sharing idea are expected in the real world. Most of my team members blamed the professor for assigning groups. She is very knowledgeable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Lots of reading for the tutorials. Her expectations are high. Do the work, read her comments to improve your work and you will do well. She is a tough grader so you have to earn your grade. She doesn't believe in extra credit. She expects you to do the work. Do the work, meet the deadlines and you will do well. She wants you to succeed. she's good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: She is an excellent professor. She knows her stuff. Though very strict she will help you if you're struggling, you just need to send her an email and she will set up a convenient time to meet with you. She will give you an extension to help you improve your grade. She insists on learning the programs and giving your best effort. No regrets!

I took this course with this professor because this was the first course in the Graphic Communication at KSU. Frankly, I wanted to take more classes with her because I heard that she was tough and demanding and I enjoyed her class. She is an excellent instructor. She's retired and I won't be able to take her upper level courses. I'm disappointed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: This professor assigns students into groups and expects us to help each other which is a good thing because that's how it is in the real world of work. She is thorough, clear and knows the programs well. I sent her an email about a problem I was having and she sent me the answer right back and it was correct. She is tough but not rude as some say.

An awesome professor who really pushes you to do your best. I looked forward to each class because she was so inspirational. I left KSU with an excellent portfolio of works from her classes. She believes in teamwork because she prepares you for the real world. She had professional graphic designers speak and give feedback of our work. Great course!

This professor is excellent. She also sets high expectations. She is caring and fair and would help you to succeed if you want to. She holds virtual office hours too. I will be transferring to another university after this semester. I learned a lot from her to prepare me for my next course. She is tough. Do your work, meet the deadlines to do well.

I will be retaking this course with this same professor so I can earn a higher grade now that I know her expectations. SHE IS TOUGH, but she gives great feedback for improvement and will allow you to redo the work for a better grade. BUT she expects you to meet the deadline. At the end of this course you would know the programs well.
Class is fairly easy and you learn a lot, however, late work is not accepted at all so one missed project could ruin your grade.

I took this class with this Professor last semester and I learned a lot, especially from the hands-on exercises. She is very strict and cab be harsh at times, but she is an excellent teacher. She does not send you to learn from YouTube as other online teachers. She teaches the technology skills you need to learn. I was happy with my grade.

Professor Mauge- Lewis's Computer Applications class is not too difficult; just thoroughly follow her instructions. My biggest issue is the way she speaks to her students; I did find it a bit disrespectful. Along with that, you can't really ask her for help outside of class; she'll make you depend on your other classmates that are in your team.

The course itself is great, but I don't recommend this professor. Most class meetings start with her complaining or blaming miscommunications on her students. Someone who can't take criticism or advice that would benefit the class and future of the course has no business teaching. Don't stress, If you do all the work and show up, you'll survive.

Honestly, the class is fine as long as you work hard and stay out of her way. She does know what she's talking about but she is flat-out mean. She talks down to students and either doesn't understand emails or just doesn't like emailing. Her D2L page can also be a maze. She also contradicts herself and if you point it out she will get very mad.

Quite honestly the most unorganized, deranged class I've ever taken. If you have a good understanding of Adobe software you'll be able to get by as the projects/assignments are not inherently hard. What DOES make them hard is the complete lack of coherence that is her D2L page. She can be very rude and gets upset if you ask for help via email.

Do not take her. Do not. I was once you, scrolling and thinking "hey, it might not be that bad!" It will be. Her directions don't make sense, she is very rude and hard to understand due to the contradictions in her directions. I'm literally going insane over her teaching style. She has office hours but doesn't grade until after them. Never again.

This professor does not play!. The students who give her poor ratings are those who do not want to work hard. She expects a lot and she sets high expectations. Most students in her class do not understand that university work is hard and she EXPECTS you to work hard to EARN the grades. I would take her for EVERY class if I could.

One of the most difficult professors I've ever had. Very rude and talks down to students. Harsh grader. Instructions are very unclear. Hard to exceed her expectations. Her feedback is extremely rude and makes students feel stupid. Extremely glad this semester is over. Strongly do not recommend.

This prof loved telling our class how "crappy" we all are at drawing. Cut people off when they are speaking, assumed she knows what they are going to say, and is generally aggressive in the way she speaks. Constructive criticism is not the same as ceaselessly insulting your students. Expectations and instructions are often conflicting and confusing

She is really rude and confusing. Although she responds to emails quickly, she makes her students feel dumb for asking questions. She’s makes a lot of contradictory remarks about assignments then gets mad when you don’t understand. Also she gets upset when students aren’t harsh during critiques and doesn’t want them to give any compliments.

Her class was 100% online but her instructions were absolutely terrible, to the point in which none us students were able to understand what she wanted us to do/turn in. I sent her an email with questions and she was rude in return. After I realized her instructions for all future projects also made no sense, I decided to drop out. Avoid.

Mauge-Lewis lacks communication skills, patience, and any empathy or understanding for her students. Her critiques and feedback are discouraging as it is extremely difficult to meet her expectations despite the large workload you will have to do for this class. There is unfortunately no way to avoid taking her class. She is inevitable.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Horrible at communication and is overall a very rude person who has little to no respect for her students. She doesnt even allow students to email her which is ridiculous for an all online class. She acts like she is above her students and its really not nice at all. I enjoy a challenge but this aint it
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: The worst teacher Ive ever had. She is a total nightmare and always has a rude attitude which makes her not approachable and when you do try to ask a question, she cuts you off before even finishing. She does not do her job as a teacher. Clearly has no respect for her students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This is the worst teacher I've ever had. It isn't just she is tough. She encourages questions but will penalize you for asking. She will make references to assignment rubrics that don't exist. And if you ask her about it she will tell you that she shouldn't need to post it for you to understand. She teaches remotely yet she forbids emailing.

Absoluetly the worst professor i've come across. Her instructions are the most vauge thing in the world. She gives feedback but then when you adjust based on the feedback she forgets she gave it and contradicts what she says. AND changes her mind last minute. Really aggravating class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Incredibly vague/arbitrary with grading; constantly changes requirements without remembering; does not offer necessary feedback until grading, causing random heavy point deductions. Never seen her graphic design work, so I'm not even sure if what I'm learning is good, credible material and skills. Would never take again if I didn't need to.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mauge-Lewis is a straight up professor. She is a good graphic designer and she definitely wants the best for her students. She is tough though, and she makes you put in a lot of work. But as long as you do good work, get lots of feedback from her, ask a ton of questions, and listen to everything she says THE FIRST TIME, she's not too bad.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Inconsistent with her grading policy and communication. This professor often takes off points then gives feedback which you will then fix. When you fix what you missed based off of her feedback she will then regrade the project as if she never looked at it. CONFUSING! She will tell you to "ask your peers" instead of helping you. Avoid if you can.

End of semester. I feel that I have learned a lot from this very caring professor. The course was rigorous, the professor tough, but fair. You can tell that she wanted us to learn and we produced some of the best works for branding a restaurant. This was the most extensive project. She is tough but you won't regret taking her class.

This professor is one of the best. She is tough, her critiques are brutal, but you do your best work in her class. Her instructions are clear. She is no-nonsense and sets high expectations. I know the classmate who gave her a negative rating on 3/29 which was very unfair. She is upset because the professor called her out. We love this professor.

Very harsh, very inconsistent. You will do lots of client work for free in your upper level design courses, which in my opinion devalues the profession. Will give you feedback on rough drafts that means very little, as she forgets that she gives it and arbitrarily removes multiple letter grades for things she has never mentioned previously.

This professor is tough, and sets very high expectations for her students. This was my first online class and she said this was her first time teaching online. She is an awesome teacher online as she is face-to-face. The projects were well-paced with ongoing reminders of due dates for projects. She pushes you to do excellent work. She's the best!
She was an inspiration. She filled our hearts with joy and happiness! I've honestly never met anyone like her, and I hope to one day follow in her footsteps.

This class opened my eyes to packaging and design. Fun projects at the start and great portfolio pieces in the end. She believes in and stresses the importance of teamwork and you will work in teams whether you like it or not. She has no favorites and is quite fair. Brutal during critiques. My favorite professor in the program!

Professor Mauge is an amazing mentor as well as designer. She pushes you to the limit and the results are always great designs. During critiques, always listen to what she has to say (gets you a better grade obviously). But overall she is not easy to please so try your best and ask her for help if you need it.

I've had her multiple times now and love her! She is soo helpful and most of the time will let you create what you want as long as it's visually appealing and good design work. My favorite graphic teacher by far! Going to try and avoid the others as much as possible and stick with her!

This portfolio class was the best ever! We published our own "real" books. We did so many real-world projects and made several field trips. Mauge-Lewis is very hands-on and expects you to accomplish all that she asks. She follows the syllabus so you cannot say that you did not know what was due or when it was due. She is an outstanding teacher.

She is so helpful and supportive to all students. She makes each class soooo enjoyable and a great place to learn and grow as a graphic designer. She is an awesome professor and really cares!!! Take her whenever you can!
This professor really cares about the success of her students. She appears easy-going but she is very thorough and quite demanding. She accepts no "crappy" work. Very likeable.
Easy A

This teacher is really great. She knows how to combine great teaching with a dash of humor to keep class motivated. She knows her stuff and presents it in the clearest manner. She will explain until you understand it. She is the only professor in the program who really cares that web design is an important and marketable skill. Take this class!
Mauge-Lewis is great! She is friendly, she managed to be interactive with a class of over 100!!! I don't think she teaches Art 1107 often, but she is still nice and I would recommend her!:)
